title: HIV Positive Scholarship
Description:: The HIV Positive Scholarship is open to full-time students who are currently living with HIV-positive status.  You must be a U.S. citizen and submit an essay of at least 400 words on how you contracted HIV, how it has affected your life and what you wish those living without HIV knew about living with the virus in order to be considered for this award.

title: Disabled Veterans Scholarship
Description:: The Disabled Veterans Scholarship is available to students who are disabled veterans of the United States Armed Forces.  You must have a disability rating of 30% and be able to provide proof of your disability and your status as a veteran to qualify for this award.  A short 100 word statement is also required.

title: Lighthouse College Bound Scholarship
Description:: The Lighthouse College Bound Scholarship is available to high school seniors who are legally blind.  You must demonstrate academic merit to be considered for this award.

title: Lighthouse Graduate School Scholarship
Description:: The Lighthouse Graduate School Scholarship is available to students who are legally blind.  You must be pursuing a Master's, PhD, or any other post-Baccalaureate degree to be considered for this award.

title: Green Home Improvement Scholarship
Description:: The Green Home Improvement Scholarship is open to high school seniors entering college and currently enrolled undergraduate and graduate students.  You must submit an essay of between 1,000 and 2,000 words on why green home improvement is important in today's world in order to be considered for this award.

title: Youth Forward Scholarship
Description:: The Youth Forward Scholarship is open to current high school and college students.  You must submit an essay of no more than 500 words on your commitment to volunteerism in order to be considered for this award.

title: Third Judicial Circuit Police Chief's Association Scholarship
Description:: The Third Judicial Circuit Police Chief's Association Scholarship is available to students at North Florida Community College.  You must be the dependent of a deceased, retired, or current law enforcement officer to be eligible for this award.

title: Leahbeth Barnard Scholarship
Description:: The Leahbeth Barnard Scholarship is available to students female students at Arapahoe Community College.  You must be single or in the process of a divorce and / or present extenuating circumstances to be considered for this award.

Provided By:: American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees, AFL-CIO
title: Union Plus Scholarship for AFSCME Members
Description:: The Union Plus Scholarship for AFSCME Members is available to the members, their spouses, and their dependent children of the American Federation of State, County, and Municipal Employees.  Members must have at least one year of continuous good-standing membership in AFSCME.  Applicants must be accepted into an accredited college, community college, or a recognized trade or technical school and submit an essay to be considered for this award.

title: Theodore Roosevelt Memorial Fund Scholarship
Description:: The Theodore Roosevelt Memorial Fund Scholarship is open to students pursuing research on North American fauna in any phase of wildlife conservation or natural history.

title: Harlequin Floors Scholarship Contest
Description:: The Harlequin Floors Scholarship Contest is open to students in the U.S. and Canada.  You must submit a dance video to be considered for this award.  Winners will be determined by public voting.

title: Robert Lane Cruikshank, Class of 1958, Scholarship
Description:: The Robert Lane Cruikshank, Class of 1958, Scholarship is open to students attending Princeton University.

Description:: The Tingle W. Culbertson War Memorial Scholarship is open to students attending Princeton University.
